00046 //_delay_us has the potential to use floating point which brings the 256 byte clz table into RAM
00047 //#include <util/delay.h>
00048 //#define delay_us( us )   ( _delay_us( ( us ) ) )
00049 //_delay_loop_2(uint16_t count) is 4 CPU cycles per iteration, up to 32 milliseconds at 8MHz
00050 #include <util/delay_basic.h>
00051 #define delay_us( us )   ( _delay_loop_2(1+(us*F_CPU)/4000000UL) )

00095 /* RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES is 1 plus the number written to the hardware. */
00096 /* Valid range 1-16, zero disables extended mode. */
00097 #ifndef RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES
00098 #define RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES 3
00099 #endif
00100 
00101 /* RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES is number of random-backoff/CCA retries. */
00102 /* The hardware will accept 0-7, but 802.15.4-2003 only allows 5 maximum */
00103 #ifndef RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES
00104 #define RF230_CONF_CSMARETRIES 5
00105 #endif

00137 #define DEBUG 0
00138 #if DEBUG
00139 #define PRINTF(FORMAT,args...) printf_P(PSTR(FORMAT),##args)
00140 #define PRINTSHORT(FORMAT,args...) printf_P(PSTR(FORMAT),##args)
00141 #else

00143 #define PRINTSHORT(...)

00146 /* Output format is suitable for text2pcap to convert to wireshark pcap file.
00147  * Use $text2pcap -e 0x809a (these_outputs) capture.pcap
00148  * Since the hardware calculates and appends the two byte checksum to Tx packets,
00149  * we just add two zero bytes to the packet dump. Don't forget to enable wireshark
00150  * 802.15.4 dissection even when the checksum is wrong!
00151  */
00152 #endif

00194 /* RF230 hardware delay times, from datasheet */
00195 typedef enum{
00196     TIME_TO_ENTER_P_ON               = 510, /**<  Transition time from VCC is applied to P_ON - most favorable case! */
00197     TIME_P_ON_TO_TRX_OFF             = 510, /**<  Transition time from P_ON to TRX_OFF. */
00198     TIME_SLEEP_TO_TRX_OFF            = 880, /**<  Transition time from SLEEP to TRX_OFF. */
00199     TIME_RESET                       = 6,   /**<  Time to hold the RST pin low during reset */
00200     TIME_ED_MEASUREMENT              = 140, /**<  Time it takes to do a ED measurement. */
00201     TIME_CCA                         = 140, /**<  Time it takes to do a CCA. */
00202     TIME_PLL_LOCK                    = 150, /**<  Maximum time it should take for the PLL to lock. */
00203     TIME_FTN_TUNING                  = 25,  /**<  Maximum time it should take to do the filter tuning. */
00204     TIME_NOCLK_TO_WAKE               = 6,   /**<  Transition time from *_NOCLK to being awake. */
00205     TIME_CMD_FORCE_TRX_OFF           = 1,   /**<  Time it takes to execute the FORCE_TRX_OFF command. */
00206     TIME_TRX_OFF_TO_PLL_ACTIVE       = 180, /**<  Transition time from TRX_OFF to: RX_ON, PLL_ON, TX_ARET_ON and RX_AACK_ON. */
00207     TIME_STATE_TRANSITION_PLL_ACTIVE = 1,   /**<  Transition time from PLL active state to another. */
00208 }radio_trx_timing_t;

00245 /* Received frames are buffered to rxframe in the interrupt routine in hal.c */

00249 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00250 /** \brief  This function return the Radio Transceivers current state.
00251  *
00252  *  \retval     P_ON               When the external supply voltage (VDD) is
00253  *                                 first supplied to the transceiver IC, the
00254  *                                 system is in the P_ON (Poweron) mode.
00255  *  \retval     BUSY_RX            The radio transceiver is busy receiving a
00256  *                                 frame.
00257  *  \retval     BUSY_TX            The radio transceiver is busy transmitting a
00258  *                                 frame.
00259  *  \retval     RX_ON              The RX_ON mode enables the analog and digital
00260  *                                 receiver blocks and the PLL frequency
00261  *                                 synthesizer.
00262  *  \retval     TRX_OFF            In this mode, the SPI module and crystal
00263  *                                 oscillator are active.
00264  *  \retval     PLL_ON             Entering the PLL_ON mode from TRX_OFF will
00265  *                                 first enable the analog voltage regulator. The
00266  *                                 transceiver is ready to transmit a frame.
00267  *  \retval     BUSY_RX_AACK       The radio was in RX_AACK_ON mode and received
00268  *                                 the Start of Frame Delimiter (SFD). State
00269  *                                 transition to BUSY_RX_AACK is done if the SFD
00270  *                                 is valid.
00271  *  \retval     BUSY_TX_ARET       The radio transceiver is busy handling the
00272  *                                 auto retry mechanism.
00273  *  \retval     RX_AACK_ON         The auto acknowledge mode of the radio is
00274  *                                 enabled and it is waiting for an incomming
00275  *                                 frame.
00276  *  \retval     TX_ARET_ON         The auto retry mechanism is enabled and the
00277  *                                 radio transceiver is waiting for the user to
00278  *                                 send the TX_START command.
00279  *  \retval     RX_ON_NOCLK        The radio transceiver is listening for
00280  *                                 incomming frames, but the CLKM is disabled so
00281  *                                 that the controller could be sleeping.
00282  *                                 However, this is only true if the controller
00283  *                                 is run from the clock output of the radio.
00284  *  \retval     RX_AACK_ON_NOCLK   Same as the RX_ON_NOCLK state, but with the
00285  *                                 auto acknowledge module turned on.
00286  *  \retval     BUSY_RX_AACK_NOCLK Same as BUSY_RX_AACK, but the controller
00287  *                                 could be sleeping since the CLKM pin is
00288  *                                 disabled.
00289  *  \retval     STATE_TRANSITION   The radio transceiver's state machine is in
00290  *                                 transition between two states.
00291  */
00292 static uint8_t
00293 radio_get_trx_state(void)
00294 {
00295     return hal_subregister_read(SR_TRX_STATUS);
00296 }
00297 
00298 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00299 /** \brief  This function checks if the radio transceiver is sleeping.
00300  *
00301  *  \retval     true    The radio transceiver is in SLEEP or one of the *_NOCLK
00302  *                      states.
00303  *  \retval     false   The radio transceiver is not sleeping.
00304  */
00305 #if 0
00306 static bool radio_is_sleeping(void)
00307 {
00308     bool sleeping = false;
00309 
00310     /* The radio transceiver will be at SLEEP or one of the *_NOCLK states only if */
00311     /* the SLP_TR pin is high. */
00312     if (hal_get_slptr() != 0){
00313         sleeping = true;
00314     }
00315 
00316     return sleeping;
00317 }
00318 #endif
00319 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00320 /** \brief  This function will reset the state machine (to TRX_OFF) from any of
00321  *          its states, except for the SLEEP state.
00322  */
00323 static void
00324 radio_reset_state_machine(void)
00325 {
00326     if (hal_get_slptr()) DEBUGFLOW('"');
00327     hal_set_slptr_low();
00328     delay_us(TIME_NOCLK_TO_WAKE);
00329     hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, CMD_FORCE_TRX_OFF);
00330     delay_us(TIME_CMD_FORCE_TRX_OFF);
00331 }
00332 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00333 static char
00334 rf230_isidle(void)
00335 {
00336   uint8_t radio_state;
00337   if (hal_get_slptr()) {
00338     DEBUGFLOW(']');
00339         return 1;
00340   } else {
00341   radio_state = hal_subregister_read(SR_TRX_STATUS);
00342   if (radio_state != BUSY_TX_ARET &&
00343       radio_state != BUSY_RX_AACK &&
00344       radio_state != STATE_TRANSITION &&
00345       radio_state != BUSY_RX && 
00346       radio_state != BUSY_TX) {
00347     return(1);
00348   } else {
00349 //    printf(".%u",radio_state);
00350     return(0);
00351   }
00352   }
00353 }
00354   
00355 static void
00356 rf230_waitidle(void)
00357 {
00358   while (1) {
00359     if (rf230_isidle()) break;
00360   }
00361 }
00362 
00363 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00364 /** \brief  This function will change the current state of the radio
00365  *          transceiver's internal state machine.
00366  *
00367  *  \param     new_state        Here is a list of possible states:
00368  *             - RX_ON        Requested transition to RX_ON state.
00369  *             - TRX_OFF      Requested transition to TRX_OFF state.
00370  *             - PLL_ON       Requested transition to PLL_ON state.
00371  *             - RX_AACK_ON   Requested transition to RX_AACK_ON state.
00372  *             - TX_ARET_ON   Requested transition to TX_ARET_ON state.
00373  *
00374  *  \retval    RADIO_SUCCESS          Requested state transition completed
00375  *                                  successfully.
00376  *  \retval    RADIO_INVALID_ARGUMENT Supplied function parameter out of bounds.
00377  *  \retval    RADIO_WRONG_STATE      Illegal state to do transition from.
00378  *  \retval    RADIO_BUSY_STATE       The radio transceiver is busy.
00379  *  \retval    RADIO_TIMED_OUT        The state transition could not be completed
00380  *                                  within resonable time.
00381  */
00382 static radio_status_t
00383 radio_set_trx_state(uint8_t new_state)
00384 {
00385     uint8_t original_state;
00386 
00387     /*Check function paramter and current state of the radio transceiver.*/
00388     if (!((new_state == TRX_OFF)    ||
00389           (new_state == RX_ON)      ||
00390           (new_state == PLL_ON)     ||
00391           (new_state == RX_AACK_ON) ||
00392           (new_state == TX_ARET_ON))){
00393         return RADIO_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00394     }
00395 
00396         if (hal_get_slptr()) {
00397         return RADIO_WRONG_STATE;
00398     }
00399 
00400     /* Wait for radio to finish previous operation */
00401     rf230_waitidle();
00402  //   for(;;)
00403  //   {
00404         original_state = radio_get_trx_state();
00405   //      if (original_state != BUSY_TX_ARET &&
00406   //          original_state != BUSY_RX_AACK &&
00407   //          original_state != BUSY_RX && 
00408   //          original_state != BUSY_TX)
00409   //          break;
00410   //  }
00411 
00412     if (new_state == original_state){
00413         return RADIO_SUCCESS;
00414     }
00415 
00416 
00417     /* At this point it is clear that the requested new_state is: */
00418     /* TRX_OFF, RX_ON, PLL_ON, RX_AACK_ON or TX_ARET_ON. */
00419 
00420     /* The radio transceiver can be in one of the following states: */
00421     /* TRX_OFF, RX_ON, PLL_ON, RX_AACK_ON, TX_ARET_ON. */
00422     if(new_state == TRX_OFF){
00423         radio_reset_state_machine(); /* Go to TRX_OFF from any state. */
00424     } else {
00425         /* It is not allowed to go from RX_AACK_ON or TX_AACK_ON and directly to */
00426         /* TX_AACK_ON or RX_AACK_ON respectively. Need to go via RX_ON or PLL_ON. */
00427         if ((new_state == TX_ARET_ON) &&
00428             (original_state == RX_AACK_ON)){
00429             /* First do intermediate state transition to PLL_ON, then to TX_ARET_ON. */
00430             /* The final state transition to TX_ARET_ON is handled after the if-else if. */
00431             hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, PLL_ON);
00432             delay_us(TIME_STATE_TRANSITION_PLL_ACTIVE);
00433         } else if ((new_state == RX_AACK_ON) &&
00434                  (original_state == TX_ARET_ON)){
00435             /* First do intermediate state transition to RX_ON, then to RX_AACK_ON. */
00436             /* The final state transition to RX_AACK_ON is handled after the if-else if. */
00437             hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, RX_ON);
00438             delay_us(TIME_STATE_TRANSITION_PLL_ACTIVE);
00439         }
00440 
00441         /* Any other state transition can be done directly. */
00442         hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, new_state);
00443 
00444         /* When the PLL is active most states can be reached in 1us. However, from */
00445         /* TRX_OFF the PLL needs time to activate. */
00446         if (original_state == TRX_OFF){
00447             delay_us(TIME_TRX_OFF_TO_PLL_ACTIVE);
00448         } else {
00449             delay_us(TIME_STATE_TRANSITION_PLL_ACTIVE);
00450         }
00451     } /*  end: if(new_state == TRX_OFF) ... */
00452 
00453     /*Verify state transition.*/
00454     radio_status_t set_state_status = RADIO_TIMED_OUT;
00455 
00456     if (radio_get_trx_state() == new_state){
00457         set_state_status = RADIO_SUCCESS;
00458     }
00459 
00460     return set_state_status;
00461 }
00462 
00463 void
00464 rf230_set_promiscuous_mode(bool isPromiscuous) {
00465 #if RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00466     is_promiscuous = isPromiscuous;
00467 /* TODO: Figure out when to pass promisc state to 802.15.4 */
00468 //    radio_set_trx_state(is_promiscuous?RX_ON:RX_AACK_ON);
00469 #endif
00470 }
00471 
00472 bool
00473 rf230_is_ready_to_send() {
00474         switch(radio_get_trx_state()) {
00475                 case BUSY_TX:
00476                 case BUSY_TX_ARET:
00477                         return false;
00478         }
00479         
00480         return true;
00481 }

00484 static void
00485 flushrx(void)
00486 {
00487   rxframe[rxframe_head].length=0;
00488 }
00489 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00490 static uint8_t locked, lock_on, lock_off;
00491 
00492 static void
00493 on(void)
00494 {
00495   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_LISTEN);
00496   
00497 #ifdef RF230BB_HOOK_RADIO_ON
00498   RF230BB_HOOK_RADIO_ON();
00499 #endif
00500 
00501   if (hal_get_slptr()) {
00502 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00503         rf230_interruptwait=1;
00504         ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_LED_RED);
00505 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00506 //      PORTE|=(1<<PE1); //ledon
00507 #endif
00508         hal_set_slptr_low();
00509         while (rf230_interruptwait) {}
00510   }
00511 #else
00512     uint8_t sreg = SREG;
00513     cli();
00514 //   DEBUGFLOW('0');
00515     hal_set_slptr_low();
00516     delay_us(TIME_SLEEP_TO_TRX_OFF);
00517     delay_us(TIME_SLEEP_TO_TRX_OFF);//extra delay for now, wake time depends on board capacitance
00518         SREG=sreg;
00519   }
00520   rf230_waitidle();
00521 #endif
00522 
00523 #if RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00524  // radio_set_trx_state(is_promiscuous?RX_ON:RX_AACK_ON);
00525   radio_set_trx_state(RX_AACK_ON);
00526 //DEBUGFLOW('a');
00527 #else
00528   radio_set_trx_state(RX_ON);
00529   DEBUGFLOW('b');
00530 #endif
00531 
00532   RF230_receive_on = 1;
00533 }
00534 static void
00535 off(void)
00536 {
00537 #ifdef RF230BB_HOOK_RADIO_OFF
00538   RF230BB_HOOK_RADIO_OFF();
00539 #endif
00540 
00541   /* Wait any transmission to end */
00542   rf230_waitidle(); 
00543   RF230_receive_on = 0;
00544 #if RADIOALWAYSON
00545 /* Do not transmit autoacks when stack thinks radio is off */
00546   radio_set_trx_state(RX_ON);
00547 //DEBUGFLOW('c');
00548 #else 
00549   /* Force the device into TRX_OFF. */   
00550   radio_reset_state_machine();
00551 #if RADIOSLEEPSWHENOFF
00552   /* Sleep Radio */
00553   hal_set_slptr_high();
00554   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_LED_RED);
00555 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00556 //  PORTE&=~(1<<PE1); //ledoff
00557 #endif
00558 // DEBUGFLOW('d');
00559 #else
00560  // DEBUGFLOW('e');
00561 #endif
00562 
00563 #endif /* RADIOALWAYSON */
00564 
00565   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_LISTEN);
00566 }
00567 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00568 #define GET_LOCK() locked = 1
00569 static void RELEASE_LOCK(void) {
00570   if(lock_on) {
00571     on();
00572     lock_on = 0;
00573   }
00574   if(lock_off) {
00575     off();
00576     lock_off = 0;
00577   }
00578   locked = 0;
00579 }
00580 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00581 static void
00582 set_txpower(uint8_t power)
00583 {
00584   if (power > TX_PWR_17_2DBM){
00585     power=TX_PWR_17_2DBM;
00586   }
00587   if (hal_get_slptr()) {
00588     DEBUGFLOW('f');
00589     PRINTF("rf230_set_txpower:Sleeping");  //happens with cxmac
00590   } else {
00591     DEBUGFLOW('g');
00592     hal_subregister_write(SR_TX_PWR, power);
00593   }
00594 }
00595 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00596 /**
00597     \brief Calibrate the internal RC oscillator
00598 
00599     This function calibrates the internal RC oscillator, based
00600     on an external 32KHz crystal connected to TIMER2. In order to
00601     verify the calibration result you can program the CKOUT fuse
00602     and monitor the CPU clock on an I/O pin.
00603 */
00604 #define AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION( ) {uint8_t volatile saved_sreg = SREG; cli( )
00605 #define AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION( ) SREG = saved_sreg;}
00606     uint8_t osccal_original,osccal_calibrated;
00607 void
00608 calibrate_rc_osc_32k(void)
00609 {
00610 #if 0
00611 
00612     /* Calibrate RC Oscillator: The calibration routine is done by clocking TIMER2
00613      * from the external 32kHz crystal while running an internal timer simultaneously.
00614      * The internal timer will be clocked at the same speed as the internal RC
00615      * oscillator, while TIMER2 is running at 32768 Hz. This way it is not necessary
00616      * to use a timed loop, and keep track cycles in timed loop vs. optimization
00617      * and compiler.
00618      */
00619     uint8_t osccal_original = OSCCAL;
00620     volatile uint16_t temp;
00621      
00622     /* Start with current value, which for some MCUs could be in upper or lower range */
00623 
00624 //  PRR0 &= ~((1 << PRTIM2)|(1 << PRTIM1)); /*  Enable Timer 1 and 2 */
00625 
00626     TIMSK2 = 0x00; /*  Disable Timer/Counter 2 interrupts. */
00627     TIMSK1 = 0x00; /*  Disable Timer/Counter 1 interrupts. */
00628 
00629     /* Enable TIMER/COUNTER 2 to be clocked from the external 32kHz clock crystal.
00630      * Then wait for the timer to become stable before doing any calibration.
00631      */
00632     ASSR |= (1 << AS2);
00633  // while (ASSR & ((1 << TCN2UB)|(1 << OCR2AUB)|(1 << TCR2AUB)|(1 << TCR2BUB))) { ; }
00634     TCCR2B = 1 << CS20;   /* run timer 2 at divide by 1 (32KHz) */
00635 
00636     delay_us(50000UL);  //crystal takes significant time to stabilize
00637     AVR_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();
00638 
00639     uint8_t counter = 128;
00640     bool cal_ok = false;
00641     do{
00642         /* wait for timer to be ready for updated config */
00643         TCCR1B = 1 << CS10;
00644 
00645         while (ASSR & ((1 << TCN2UB)|(1 << OCR2AUB)|(1 << TCR2AUB)|(1 << TCR2BUB))) { ; }
00646 
00647         TCNT2 = 0x80;
00648         TCNT1 = 0;
00649 
00650         TIFR2 = 0xFF; /* Clear TIFR2 flags (Yes, really) */
00651 
00652         /* Wait for TIMER/COUNTER 2 to overflow. Stop TIMER/COUNTER 1 and 2, and
00653          * read the counter value of TIMER/COUNTER 1. It will now contain the
00654          * number of cpu cycles elapsed within the 3906.25 microsecond period.
00655          */
00656         while (!(TIFR2 & (1 << TOV2))){
00657             ;
00658             }
00659         temp = TCNT1;
00660 
00661         TCCR1B = 0;
00662 /* Defining these as floating point introduces a lot of code and the 256 byte .clz table to RAM */
00663 /* At 8 MHz we would expect 8*3906.25 = 31250 CPU clocks */
00664 #define cal_upper 32812 //(31250*1.05) // 32812 = 0x802c
00665 #define cal_lower 29687 //(31250*0.95) // 29687 = 0x73f7
00666         /* Iteratively reduce the error to be within limits */
00667         if (temp < cal_lower) {
00668             /* Too slow. Put the hammer down. */
00669             if (OSCCAL==0x7e) break; //stay in lowest range
00670             if (OSCCAL==0xff) break;
00671             OSCCAL++;
00672         } else if (temp > cal_upper) {
00673             /* Too fast, retard. */
00674             if (OSCCAL==0x81) break; //stay in highest range
00675             if (OSCCAL==0x00) break;
00676             OSCCAL--;
00677         } else {
00678             /* The CPU clock frequency is now within +/- 0.5% of the target value. */
00679             cal_ok = true;
00680         }
00681 
00682         counter--;
00683     } while ((counter != 0) && (false == cal_ok));
00684 
00685      osccal_calibrated=OSCCAL;   
00686     if (true != cal_ok) {
00687         /* We failed, therefore restore previous OSCCAL value. */
00688         OSCCAL = osccal_original;
00689     }
00690 
00691     OSCCAL = osccal_original;
00692     TCCR2B = 0;
00693 
00694     ASSR &= ~(1 << AS2);
00695 
00696     /* Disable both timers again to save power. */
00697     //    PRR0 |= (1 << PRTIM2);/* |(1 << PRTIM1); */
00698 
00699     AVR_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION();
00700 #endif
00701 }
00702 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00703 int
00704 rf230_init(void)
00705 {
00706   uint8_t i;
00707   DEBUGFLOW('i');
00708 
00709   /* Wait in case VCC just applied */
00710   delay_us(TIME_TO_ENTER_P_ON);
00711  
00712   /* Calibrate oscillator */
00713  // printf_P(PSTR("\nBefore calibration OSCCAL=%x\n"),OSCCAL);
00714  // calibrate_rc_osc_32k();
00715  // printf_P(PSTR("After calibration OSCCAL=%x\n"),OSCCAL); 
00716 
00717   /* Initialize Hardware Abstraction Layer */
00718   hal_init();
00719   
00720   /* Set receive buffers empty and point to the first */
00721   for (i=0;i<RF230_CONF_RX_BUFFERS;i++) rxframe[i].length=0;
00722   rxframe_head=0;rxframe_tail=0;
00723   
00724   /* Do full rf230 Reset */
00725   hal_set_rst_low();
00726   hal_set_slptr_low();
00727   delay_us(TIME_RESET);
00728   hal_set_rst_high();
00729 
00730   /* Force transition to TRX_OFF */
00731   hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, CMD_FORCE_TRX_OFF);
00732   delay_us(TIME_P_ON_TO_TRX_OFF);
00733   
00734   /* Verify that it is a supported version */
00735   /* Note gcc optimizes this away if DEBUG is not set! */
00736   //ATMEGA128RFA1 - version 4, ID 31
00737   uint8_t tvers = hal_register_read(RG_VERSION_NUM);
00738   uint8_t tmanu = hal_register_read(RG_MAN_ID_0);
00739 
00740   if ((tvers != RF230_REVA) && (tvers != RF230_REVB))
00741     PRINTF("rf230: Unsupported version %u\n",tvers);
00742   if (tmanu != SUPPORTED_MANUFACTURER_ID) 
00743     PRINTF("rf230: Unsupported manufacturer ID %u\n",tmanu);
00744 
00745   PRINTF("rf230: Version %u, ID %u\n",tvers,tmanu);
00746   
00747   rf230_warm_reset();
00748  
00749  /* Start the packet receive process */
00750   process_start(&rf230_process, NULL);
00751  
00752  /* Leave radio in on state (?)*/
00753   on();
00754 
00755   return 1;
00756 }
00757 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00758 /* Used to reinitialize radio parameters without losing pan and mac address, channel, power, etc. */
00759 void rf230_warm_reset(void) {
00760 #if RF230_CONF_SNEEZER && JACKDAW
00761   /* Take jackdaw radio out of test mode */
00762 #warning Manipulating PORTB pins for RF230 Sneezer mode!
00763   PORTB &= ~(1<<7);
00764   DDRB  &= ~(1<<7);
00765 #endif
00766   
00767   hal_register_write(RG_IRQ_MASK, RF230_SUPPORTED_INTERRUPT_MASK);
00768 
00769   /* Set up number of automatic retries 0-15 (0 implies PLL_ON sends instead of the extended TX_ARET mode */
00770   hal_subregister_write(SR_MAX_FRAME_RETRIES, RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES );
00771  
00772  /* Set up carrier sense/clear channel assesment parameters for extended operating mode */
00773   hal_subregister_write(SR_MAX_CSMA_RETRIES, 5 );//highest allowed retries
00774   hal_register_write(RG_CSMA_BE, 0x80);       //min backoff exponent 0, max 8 (highest allowed)
00775   hal_register_write(RG_CSMA_SEED_0,hal_register_read(RG_PHY_RSSI) );//upper two RSSI reg bits RND_VALUE are random in rf231
00776  // hal_register_write(CSMA_SEED_1,42 );
00777 
00778   /* CCA Mode Mode 1=Energy above threshold  2=Carrier sense only  3=Both 0=Either (RF231 only) */
00779 //hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_MODE,1);  //1 is the power-on default
00780 
00781   /* Carrier sense threshold (not implemented in RF230 or RF231) */
00782 // hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_CS_THRES,1);
00783 
00784   /* CCA energy threshold = -91dB + 2*SR_CCA_ED_THRESH. Reset defaults to -77dB */
00785   /* Use RF230 base of -91;  RF231 base is -90 according to datasheet */
00786 #ifdef RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES
00787 #if RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES < -91
00788 #warning
00789 #warning RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES below hardware limit, setting to -91dBm
00790 #warning
00791   hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_ED_THRES,0);  
00792 #elif RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES > -61
00793 #warning
00794 #warning RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES above hardware limit, setting to -61dBm
00795 #warning
00796   hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_ED_THRES,15);  
00797 #else
00798   hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_ED_THRES,(RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES+91)/2);  
00799 #endif
00800 #endif
00801 
00802   /* Use automatic CRC unless manual is specified */
00803 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
00804   hal_subregister_write(SR_TX_AUTO_CRC_ON, 0);
00805 #else
00806   hal_subregister_write(SR_TX_AUTO_CRC_ON, 1);
00807 #endif
00808 
00809 /* Limit tx power for testing miniature Raven mesh */
00810 #ifdef RF230_MAX_TX_POWER
00811   set_txpower(RF230_MAX_TX_POWER);  //0=3dbm 15=-17.2dbm
00812 #endif
00813 }
00814 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00815 static uint8_t buffer[RF230_MAX_TX_FRAME_LENGTH+AUX_LEN];
00816 
00817 static int
00818 rf230_transmit(unsigned short payload_len)
00819 {
00820   int txpower;
00821   uint8_t total_len;
00822   uint8_t radiowason;
00823   uint8_t tx_result;
00824 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
00825   struct timestamp timestamp;
00826 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
00827 
00828   GET_LOCK();
00829 
00830   /* Save receiver state */
00831   radiowason=RF230_receive_on;
00832 
00833   /* If radio is sleeping we have to turn it on first */
00834   /* This automatically does the PLL calibrations */
00835   if (hal_get_slptr()) {
00836 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00837         if (radiowason) DEBUGFLOW('e');
00838         radiowason=0;
00839 //      DEBUGFLOW('j');
00840         ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_LED_RED);
00841 #if RF230BB_CONF_LEDONPORTE1
00842 //      PORTE|=(1<<PE1); //ledon
00843 #endif
00844         rf230_interruptwait=1;
00845         hal_set_slptr_low();
00846         while (rf230_interruptwait) {}  
00847 #else
00848     hal_set_slptr_low();
00849         DEBUGFLOW('j');
00850     delay_us(TIME_SLEEP_TO_TRX_OFF);
00851         delay_us(TIME_SLEEP_TO_TRX_OFF); //extra delay depends on board capacitance
00852 #endif
00853 
00854   } else {
00855 #if RADIO_CONF_CALIBRATE_INTERVAL
00856   /* If nonzero, do periodic calibration. See clock.c */
00857     if (rf230_calibrate) {
00858           DEBUGFLOW('k');
00859       hal_subregister_write(SR_PLL_CF_START,1);   //takes 80us max
00860       hal_subregister_write(SR_PLL_DCU_START,1); //takes 6us, concurrently
00861       rf230_calibrate=0;
00862       rf230_calibrated=1;
00863       delay_us(80); //?
00864     }
00865 #endif
00866   }
00867  
00868   /* Wait for any previous operation or state transition to finish */
00869   rf230_waitidle();
00870   if(RF230_receive_on) {
00871     ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_LISTEN);
00872   }
00873   /* Prepare to transmit */
00874 #if RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES
00875   radio_set_trx_state(TX_ARET_ON);
00876   DEBUGFLOW('t');
00877 #else
00878   radio_set_trx_state(PLL_ON);
00879   DEBUGFLOW('T');
00880 #endif
00881 
00882   txpower = 0;
00883   
00884   if(packetbuf_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_RADIO_TXPOWER) > 0) {
00885     /* Remember the current transmission power */
00886     txpower = rf230_get_txpower();
00887     /* Set the specified transmission power */
00888     set_txpower(packetbuf_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_RADIO_TXPOWER) - 1);
00889   }
00890 
00891   total_len = payload_len + AUX_LEN;
00892 
00893 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
00894   rtimer_clock_t txtime = timesynch_time();
00895 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
00896 
00897   ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_TRANSMIT);
00898   
00899 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00900 /* No interrupts across frame download! */
00901   cli();
00902 /* slow down the transmit? */
00903  //   delay_us(500);
00904 #endif
00905  /* Toggle the SLP_TR pin to initiate the frame transmission */
00906   hal_set_slptr_high();
00907   hal_set_slptr_low();
00908   hal_frame_write(buffer, total_len);
00909 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00910  sei();
00911 #endif
00912   PRINTF("rf230_transmit:\n");
00913 #if DEBUG>1
00914 /* Note the dumped packet will have a zero checksum unless compiled with RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
00915  * since we don't know what it will be if calculated by the hardware.
00916  */
00917   {
00918     uint8_t i;
00919     PRINTF("0000");       //Start a new wireshark packet
00920     for (i=0;i<total_len;i++) PRINTF(" %02x",buffer[i]);
00921     PRINTF("\n");
00922   }
00923 #endif
00924 
00925 #if RADIOSTATS
00926   RF230_sendpackets++;
00927 #endif
00928  
00929  /* We wait until transmission has ended so that we get an
00930      accurate measurement of the transmission time.*/
00931   rf230_waitidle();
00932 
00933  /* Get the transmission result */  
00934 #if RF230_CONF_AUTORETRIES
00935   tx_result = hal_subregister_read(SR_TRAC_STATUS);
00936 #else
00937   tx_result=0;
00938 #endif
00939 
00940 #ifdef ENERGEST_CONF_LEVELDEVICE_LEVELS
00941   ENERGEST_OFF_LEVEL(ENERGEST_TYPE_TRANSMIT,rf230_get_txpower());
00942 #endif
00943 
00944  /* Restore the transmission power */
00945  if(packetbuf_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_RADIO_TXPOWER) > 0) {
00946     set_txpower(txpower & 0xff);
00947   }
00948  
00949   /* Restore receive mode */
00950   if(radiowason) {
00951     DEBUGFLOW('l');
00952     on();
00953   } else {
00954     off();
00955   }
00956 
00957 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
00958   setup_time_for_transmission = txtime - timestamp.time;
00959 
00960   if(num_transmissions < 10000) {
00961     total_time_for_transmission += timesynch_time() - txtime;
00962     total_transmission_len += total_len;
00963     num_transmissions++;
00964   }
00965 
00966 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
00967 
00968   ENERGEST_OFF(ENERGEST_TYPE_TRANSMIT);
00969   if(RF230_receive_on) {
00970     ENERGEST_ON(ENERGEST_TYPE_LISTEN);
00971   } else {
00972 #if RADIOALWAYSON
00973     /* Enable reception */
00974     on();
00975 #else
00976     /* Go to lower power TRX_OFF state (turn off PLL) */
00977     hal_subregister_write(SR_TRX_CMD, CMD_FORCE_TRX_OFF);
00978 #endif
00979   }
00980 
00981   RELEASE_LOCK();
00982   if (tx_result==1) {               //success, data pending from adressee
00983     tx_result = RADIO_TX_OK;        //Just show success?
00984   } else if (tx_result==3) {        //CSMA channel access failure
00985     DEBUGFLOW('m');
00986     RIMESTATS_ADD(contentiondrop);
00987     PRINTF("rf230_transmit: Transmission never started\n");
00988     tx_result = RADIO_TX_COLLISION;
00989   } else if (tx_result==5) {        //Expected ACK, none received
00990     DEBUGFLOW('n');
00991     tx_result = RADIO_TX_NOACK;
00992   } else if (tx_result==7) {        //Invalid (Can't happen since waited for idle above?)
00993     DEBUGFLOW('o');
00994     tx_result = RADIO_TX_ERR;
00995   }
00996 
00997   return tx_result;
00998 }
00999 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01000 static int
01001 rf230_prepare(const void *payload, unsigned short payload_len)
01002 {
01003   int ret = 0;
01004   uint8_t total_len,*pbuf;
01005 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01006   struct timestamp timestamp;
01007 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01008 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01009   uint16_t checksum;
01010 #endif /* RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM */
01011 
01012   GET_LOCK();
01013   DEBUGFLOW('p');
01014 
01015 //  PRINTF("rf230: sending %d bytes\n", payload_len);
01016 //  PRINTSHORT("s%d ",payload_len);
01017 
01018   RIMESTATS_ADD(lltx);
01019 
01020 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01021   checksum = crc16_data(payload, payload_len, 0);
01022 #endif
01023  
01024   /* Copy payload to RAM buffer */
01025   total_len = payload_len + AUX_LEN;
01026   if (total_len > RF230_MAX_TX_FRAME_LENGTH){
01027 #if RADIOSTATS
01028     RF230_sendfail++;
01029 #endif
01030 #if DEBUG
01031     printf_P(PSTR("rf230_prepare: packet too large (%d, max: %d)\n"),total_len,RF230_MAX_TX_FRAME_LENGTH);
01032 #endif
01033     ret = -1;
01034         goto bail;
01035   }
01036   pbuf=&buffer[0];
01037   memcpy(pbuf,payload,payload_len);
01038   pbuf+=payload_len;
01039 
01040 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01041   memcpy(pbuf,&checksum,CHECKSUM_LEN);
01042   pbuf+=CHECKSUM_LEN;
01043 #endif
01044 
01045 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01046   timestamp.authority_level = timesynch_authority_level();
01047   timestamp.time = timesynch_time();
01048   memcpy(pbuf,&timestamp,TIMESTAMP_LEN);
01049   pbuf+=TIMESTAMP_LEN;
01050 #endif
01051 /*------------------------------------------------------------*/  
01052 
01053 #ifdef RF230BB_HOOK_TX_PACKET
01054 #if !RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01055   { // Add a checksum before we log the packet out
01056     uint16_t checksum;
01057     checksum = crc16_data(payload, payload_len, 0);
01058     memcpy(buffer+total_len-CHECKSUM_LEN,&checksum,CHECKSUM_LEN);
01059   }
01060 #endif /* RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM */
01061   RF230BB_HOOK_TX_PACKET(buffer,total_len);
01062 #endif
01063   
01064 
01065 bail:
01066   RELEASE_LOCK();
01067   return ret;
01068 }
01069 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01070 static int
01071 rf230_send(const void *payload, unsigned short payload_len)
01072 {
01073         int ret = 0;
01074 
01075 #ifdef RF230BB_HOOK_IS_SEND_ENABLED
01076         if(!RF230BB_HOOK_IS_SEND_ENABLED()) {
01077                 goto bail;
01078         }
01079 #endif
01080         
01081         if((ret=rf230_prepare(payload, payload_len))) {
01082 #if DEBUG
01083                 printf_P(PSTR("rf230_send: Unable to send, prep failed (%d)\n"),ret);
01084 #endif
01085                 goto bail;
01086         }
01087 
01088         ret = rf230_transmit(payload_len);
01089         
01090 bail:
01091 #if RADIOSTATS
01092     if (ret) RF230_sendfail++;
01093 #endif
01094         return ret;
01095 }
01096 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01097 int
01098 rf230_off(void)
01099 {
01100   /* Don't do anything if we are already turned off. */
01101   if(RF230_receive_on == 0) {
01102     return 0;
01103   }
01104 
01105   /* If we are called when the driver is locked, we indicate that the
01106      radio should be turned off when the lock is unlocked. */
01107   if(locked) {
01108     lock_off = 1;
01109     return 1;
01110   }
01111 
01112   /* If we are currently receiving a packet
01113      we don't actually switch the radio off now, but signal that the
01114      driver should switch off the radio once the packet has been
01115      received and processed, by setting the 'lock_off' variable. */
01116   if (!rf230_isidle()) {
01117     lock_off = 1;
01118     return 1;
01119   }
01120 
01121   off();
01122   return 0;
01123 }
01124 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01125 int
01126 rf230_on(void)
01127 {
01128   if(RF230_receive_on) {
01129     DEBUGFLOW('q');
01130     return 1;
01131   }
01132   if(locked) {
01133     lock_on = 1;
01134         DEBUGFLOW('r');
01135     return 1;
01136   }
01137 
01138   on();
01139   return 1;
01140 }
01141 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01142 uint8_t
01143 rf230_get_channel(void)
01144 {
01145 //jackdaw reads zero channel, raven reads correct channel?
01146 //return hal_subregister_read(SR_CHANNEL);
01147   return channel;
01148 }
01149 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01150 void
01151 rf230_set_channel(uint8_t c)
01152 {
01153  /* Wait for any transmission to end. */
01154   PRINTF("rf230: Set Channel %u\n",c);
01155   rf230_waitidle();
01156   channel=c;
01157   hal_subregister_write(SR_CHANNEL, c);
01158 }
01159 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01160 void
01161 rf230_listen_channel(uint8_t c)
01162 {
01163  /* Same as set channel but forces RX_ON state for sniffer or energy scan */
01164 //  PRINTF("rf230: Listen Channel %u\n",c);
01165   rf230_set_channel(c);
01166   radio_set_trx_state(RX_ON);
01167 }
01168 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01169 void
01170 rf230_set_pan_addr(unsigned pan,
01171                     unsigned addr,
01172                     const uint8_t ieee_addr[8])
01173 //rf230_set_pan_addr(uint16_t pan,uint16_t addr,uint8_t *ieee_addr)
01174 {
01175   PRINTF("rf230: PAN=%x Short Addr=%x\n",pan,addr);
01176   
01177   uint8_t abyte;
01178   abyte = pan & 0xFF;
01179   hal_register_write(RG_PAN_ID_0,abyte);
01180   abyte = (pan >> 8*1) & 0xFF;
01181   hal_register_write(RG_PAN_ID_1, abyte);
01182 
01183   abyte = addr & 0xFF;
01184   hal_register_write(RG_SHORT_ADDR_0, abyte);
01185   abyte = (addr >> 8*1) & 0xFF;
01186   hal_register_write(RG_SHORT_ADDR_1, abyte);  
01187 
01188   if (ieee_addr != NULL) {
01189     PRINTF("MAC=%x",*ieee_addr);
01190     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_7, *ieee_addr++);
01191     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01192     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_6, *ieee_addr++);
01193     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01194     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_5, *ieee_addr++);
01195     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01196     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_4, *ieee_addr++);
01197     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01198     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_3, *ieee_addr++);
01199     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01200     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_2, *ieee_addr++);
01201     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01202     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_1, *ieee_addr++);
01203     PRINTF(":%x",*ieee_addr);
01204     hal_register_write(RG_IEEE_ADDR_0, *ieee_addr);
01205     PRINTF("\n");
01206   }
01207 }
01208 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01209 /*
01210  * Interrupt leaves frame intact in FIFO.
01211  */
01212 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01213 static volatile rtimer_clock_t interrupt_time;
01214 static volatile int interrupt_time_set;
01215 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01216 #if RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING
01217 #define rf230_timetable_size 16
01218 TIMETABLE(rf230_timetable);
01219 TIMETABLE_AGGREGATE(aggregate_time, 10);
01220 #endif /* RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING */
01221 int
01222 rf230_interrupt(void)
01223 {
01224   /* Poll the receive process, unless the stack thinks the radio is off */
01225 #if RADIOALWAYSON
01226 if (RF230_receive_on) {
01227   DEBUGFLOW('+');
01228 #endif
01229 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01230   interrupt_time = timesynch_time();
01231   interrupt_time_set = 1;
01232 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01233 
01234   process_poll(&rf230_process);
01235   
01236 #if RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING
01237   timetable_clear(&rf230_timetable);
01238   TIMETABLE_TIMESTAMP(rf230_timetable, "interrupt");
01239 #endif /* RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING */
01240 
01241   rf230_pending = 1;
01242   
01243 #if RADIOSTATS //TODO:This will double count buffered packets
01244   RF230_receivepackets++;
01245 #endif
01246 
01247 #if RADIOALWAYSON
01248 } else {
01249   DEBUGFLOW('-');
01250   rxframe[rxframe_head].length=0;
01251 }
01252 #endif
01253   return 1;
01254 }
01255 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01256 /* Process to handle input packets
01257  * Receive interrupts cause this process to be polled
01258  * It calls the core MAC layer which calls rf230_read to get the packet
01259  * rf230processflag can be printed in the main idle loop for debugging
01260  */
01261 #if 0
01262 uint8_t rf230processflag;
01263 #define RF230PROCESSFLAG(arg) rf230processflag=arg
01264 #else
01265 #define RF230PROCESSFLAG(arg)
01266 #endif
01267 
01268 PROCESS_THREAD(rf230_process, ev, data)
01269 {
01270   int len;
01271   PROCESS_BEGIN();
01272   RF230PROCESSFLAG(99);
01273 
01274   while(1) {
01275     PROCESS_YIELD_UNTIL(ev == PROCESS_EVENT_POLL);
01276     RF230PROCESSFLAG(42);
01277 #if RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING
01278     TIMETABLE_TIMESTAMP(rf230_timetable, "poll");
01279 #endif /* RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING */
01280 
01281     rf230_pending = 0;
01282 
01283     packetbuf_clear();
01284     len = rf230_read(packetbuf_dataptr(), PACKETBUF_SIZE);        
01285     RF230PROCESSFLAG(1);
01286     if(len > 0) {
01287       packetbuf_set_datalen(len);
01288       RF230PROCESSFLAG(2);
01289       NETSTACK_RDC.input();
01290 #if RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING
01291       TIMETABLE_TIMESTAMP(rf230_timetable, "end");
01292       timetable_aggregate_compute_detailed(&aggregate_time,
01293                                            &rf230_timetable);
01294       timetable_clear(&rf230_timetable);
01295 #endif /* RF230_TIMETABLE_PROFILING */
01296     } else {
01297 #if RADIOSTATS
01298        RF230_receivefail++;
01299 #endif
01300     }
01301   }
01302 
01303   PROCESS_END();
01304 }
01305 /* Get packet from Radio if any, else return zero.
01306  * The two-byte checksum is appended but the returned length does not include it.
01307  * Frames are buffered in the interrupt routine so this routine
01308  * does not access the hardware or change its status
01309  */
01310 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01311 static int
01312 rf230_read(void *buf, unsigned short bufsize)
01313 {
01314   uint8_t len,*framep;
01315 #if FOOTER_LEN
01316   uint8_t footer[FOOTER_LEN];
01317 #endif /* FOOTER_LEN */
01318 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01319   uint16_t checksum;
01320 #endif /* RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM */
01321 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01322   struct timestamp t;
01323 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01324   /* The length includes the twp-byte checksum but not the LQI byte */
01325   len=rxframe[rxframe_head].length;
01326   if (len==0) {
01327 #if RADIOALWAYSON && DEBUGFLOWSIZE
01328    if (RF230_receive_on==0) {if (debugflow[debugflowsize-1]!='z') DEBUGFLOW('z');} //cxmac calls with radio off?
01329 #endif
01330     return 0;
01331   }
01332 
01333 #if RADIOALWAYSON
01334 if (RF230_receive_on) {
01335 #else
01336 if (hal_get_slptr()) {
01337   DEBUGFLOW('!');
01338   return 0;
01339 }
01340 if (!RF230_receive_on) {
01341   DEBUGFLOW('[');
01342   return 0;
01343 }
01344 #endif
01345 
01346 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01347   if(interrupt_time_set) {
01348     rf230_time_of_arrival = interrupt_time;
01349     interrupt_time_set = 0;
01350   } else {
01351     rf230_time_of_arrival = 0;
01352   }
01353   rf230_time_of_departure = 0;
01354 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01355 
01356 // PRINTSHORT("r%d",rxframe[rxframe_head].length);  
01357   PRINTF("rf230_read: %u bytes lqi %u crc %u\n",rxframe[rxframe_head].length,rxframe[rxframe_head].lqi,rxframe[rxframe_head].crc);
01358 #if DEBUG>1
01359  {
01360     uint8_t i;
01361     PRINTF("0000");
01362     for (i=0;i<rxframe[rxframe_head].length;i++) PRINTF(" %02x",rxframe[rxframe_head].data[i]);    
01363     PRINTF("\n");
01364   }
01365 #endif
01366 
01367 // GET_LOCK();
01368 
01369 //if(len > RF230_MAX_PACKET_LEN) {
01370   if(len > RF230_MAX_TX_FRAME_LENGTH) {
01371     /* Oops, we must be out of sync. */
01372     DEBUGFLOW('u');
01373     flushrx();
01374     RIMESTATS_ADD(badsynch);
01375 //    RELEASE_LOCK();
01376     return 0;
01377   }
01378 
01379   if(len <= AUX_LEN) {
01380     DEBUGFLOW('s');
01381     PRINTF("len <= AUX_LEN\n");
01382     flushrx();
01383     RIMESTATS_ADD(tooshort);
01384  //   RELEASE_LOCK();
01385     return 0;
01386   }
01387 
01388   if(len - AUX_LEN > bufsize) {
01389     DEBUGFLOW('v');
01390     PRINTF("len - AUX_LEN > bufsize\n");
01391     flushrx();
01392     RIMESTATS_ADD(toolong);
01393 //    RELEASE_LOCK();
01394     return 0;
01395   }
01396  /* Transfer the frame, stripping the footer, but copying the checksum */
01397   framep=&(rxframe[rxframe_head].data[0]);
01398   memcpy(buf,framep,len-AUX_LEN+CHECKSUM_LEN);
01399   rf230_last_correlation = rxframe[rxframe_head].lqi;
01400 
01401   /* Clear the length field to allow buffering of the next packet */
01402   rxframe[rxframe_head].length=0;
01403   rxframe_head++;if (rxframe_head >= RF230_CONF_RX_BUFFERS) rxframe_head=0;
01404   /* If another packet has been buffered, schedule another receive poll */
01405   if (rxframe[rxframe_head].length) rf230_interrupt();
01406   
01407  /* Point to the checksum */
01408   framep+=len-AUX_LEN; 
01409 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01410   memcpy(&checksum,framep,CHECKSUM_LEN);
01411 #endif /* RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM */
01412   framep+=CHECKSUM_LEN;
01413 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01414   memcpy(&t,framep,TIMESTAMP_LEN);
01415 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01416   framep+=TIMESTAMP_LEN;
01417 #if FOOTER_LEN
01418   memcpy(footer,framep,FOOTER_LEN);
01419 #endif
01420 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01421   if(checksum != crc16_data(buf, len - AUX_LEN, 0)) {
01422     DEBUGFLOW('w');
01423     PRINTF("checksum failed 0x%04x != 0x%04x\n",
01424       checksum, crc16_data(buf, len - AUX_LEN, 0));
01425   }
01426 #if FOOTER_LEN
01427   if(footer[1] & FOOTER1_CRC_OK &&
01428      checksum == crc16_data(buf, len - AUX_LEN, 0)) {
01429 #endif
01430 #endif /* RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM */
01431 
01432 /* Get the received signal strength for the packet, 0-84 dB above rx threshold */
01433 #if 0   //more general
01434     rf230_last_rssi = rf230_get_raw_rssi();
01435 #else   //faster
01436 #if RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
01437  //   rf230_last_rssi = hal_subregister_read(SR_ED_LEVEL);  //0-84 resolution 1 dB
01438     rf230_last_rssi = hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL);  //0-84, resolution 1 dB
01439 #else
01440 /* last_rssi will have been set at RX_START interrupt */
01441 //  rf230_last_rssi = 3*hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);    //0-28 resolution 3 dB
01442 #endif
01443 #endif /* speed vs. generality */
01444 
01445   /* Save the smallest rssi. The display routine can reset by setting it to zero */
01446   if ((rf230_smallest_rssi==0) || (rf230_last_rssi<rf230_smallest_rssi))
01447      rf230_smallest_rssi=rf230_last_rssi;
01448 
01449  //   rf230_last_correlation = rxframe[rxframe_head].lqi;
01450     packetbuf_set_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_RSSI, rf230_last_rssi);
01451     packetbuf_set_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_LINK_QUALITY, rf230_last_correlation);
01452 
01453     RIMESTATS_ADD(llrx);
01454 
01455 #if RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS
01456     rf230_time_of_departure =
01457       t.time +
01458       setup_time_for_transmission +
01459       (total_time_for_transmission * (len - 2)) / total_transmission_len;
01460 
01461     rf230_authority_level_of_sender = t.authority_level;
01462 
01463     packetbuf_set_attr(PACKETBUF_ATTR_TIMESTAMP, t.time);
01464 #endif /* RF230_CONF_TIMESTAMPS */
01465 
01466 #if RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
01467 #if FOOTER_LEN
01468   } else {
01469     DEBUGFLOW('x');
01470     PRINTF("bad crc");
01471     RIMESTATS_ADD(badcrc);
01472     len = AUX_LEN;
01473   }
01474 #endif
01475 #endif
01476 
01477 #ifdef RF230BB_HOOK_RX_PACKET
01478   RF230BB_HOOK_RX_PACKET(buf,len);
01479 #endif
01480 
01481   /* Here return just the data length. The checksum is however still in the buffer for packet sniffing */
01482   return len - AUX_LEN;
01483 
01484 #if RADIOALWAYSON
01485 } else {
01486    DEBUGFLOW('y');  //Stack thought radio was off
01487    return 0;
01488 }
01489 #endif
01490 }
01491 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01492 void
01493 rf230_set_txpower(uint8_t power)
01494 {
01495   GET_LOCK();
01496   set_txpower(power);
01497   RELEASE_LOCK();
01498 }
01499 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01500 uint8_t
01501 rf230_get_txpower(void)
01502 {
01503         uint8_t power = TX_PWR_UNDEFINED;
01504         if (hal_get_slptr()) {
01505                 PRINTF("rf230_get_txpower:Sleeping");
01506         } else {
01507                 power = hal_subregister_read(SR_TX_PWR);
01508         }
01509         return power;
01510 }
01511 
01512 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01513 uint8_t
01514 rf230_get_raw_rssi(void)
01515 {
01516   uint8_t rssi,state;
01517   bool radio_was_off = 0;
01518 
01519   /*The RSSI measurement should only be done in RX_ON or BUSY_RX.*/
01520   if(!RF230_receive_on) {
01521     radio_was_off = 1;
01522     rf230_on();
01523   }
01524 
01525 /* The energy detect register is used in extended mode (since RSSI will read 0) */
01526 /* The rssi register is multiplied by 3 to a consistent value from either register */
01527   state=radio_get_trx_state();
01528   if ((state==RX_AACK_ON) || (state==BUSY_RX_AACK)) {
01529  //  rssi = hal_subregister_read(SR_ED_LEVEL);  //0-84, resolution 1 dB
01530      rssi = hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL);  //0-84, resolution 1 dB
01531   } else {
01532 #if 0   // 3-clock shift and add is faster on machines with no hardware multiply
01533 /* avr-gcc may have an -Os bug that uses the general subroutine for multiplying by 3 */
01534      rssi = hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);      //0-28, resolution 3 dB
01535      rssi = (rssi << 1)  + rssi;                //*3
01536 #else  // 1 or 2 clock multiply, or compiler with correct optimization
01537      rssi = 3 * hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);
01538 #endif
01539 
01540   }
01541 
01542   if(radio_was_off) {
01543     rf230_off();
01544   }
01545   return rssi;
01546 }
01547 
01548 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01549 static int
01550 rf230_cca(void)
01551 {
01552   uint8_t cca=0;
01553   uint8_t radio_was_off = 0;
01554   uint8_t volatile saved_sreg = SREG;
01555 
01556   /* If the radio is locked by an underlying thread (because we are
01557      being invoked through an interrupt), we preted that the coast is
01558      clear (i.e., no packet is currently being transmitted by a
01559      neighbor). */
01560   if(locked) {
01561     DEBUGFLOW('|');
01562  //   return 1; rf230 hangs on occasion?
01563             return 0;
01564   }
01565 
01566   /* Don't allow interrupts! */
01567   cli();
01568 
01569   /* Turn radio on if necessary. If radio is currently busy return busy channel */
01570   /* This may happen when testing radio duty cycling with RADIOALWAYSON */
01571 
01572   if(RF230_receive_on) {
01573     if (hal_get_slptr()) {  //should not be sleeping!
01574           DEBUGFLOW('<');
01575           goto busyexit;
01576         } else {
01577       if (!rf230_isidle()) {DEBUGFLOW('2');goto busyexit;}
01578         }
01579   } else {
01580     DEBUGFLOW('3');
01581     radio_was_off = 1;
01582     rf230_on();
01583   }
01584 
01585   /* CCA Mode Mode 1=Energy above threshold  2=Carrier sense only  3=Both 0=Either (RF231 only) */
01586   /* Use the current mode. Note triggering a manual CCA is not recommended in extended mode */
01587 //hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_MODE,1);
01588 
01589   /* Start the CCA, wait till done, return result */
01590   /* Note reading the TRX_STATUS register clears both CCA_STATUS and CCA_DONE bits */
01591 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
01592   /* Manual CCA gives no interrupt in extended mode, and testing cca done hangs the MCU */
01593 #if 0
01594         rf230_interruptwait=1;
01595     sei();
01596     hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_REQUEST,1);
01597         while (rf230_interruptwait) {}
01598     cca=hal_register_read(RG_TRX_STATUS);
01599 #endif
01600   /* So just read the current ED register without delay */
01601   /* CCA energy threshold = -91dB + 2*SR_CCA_ED_THRESH. Reset defaults to -77dB */
01602 #ifdef RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES
01603     if (hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL)<(91+RF230_CONF_CCA_THRES) cca=0xff;
01604 #else
01605         if (hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL)<(91-77)) cca=0xff;
01606 #endif
01607 
01608 
01609 #else /* RF230, RF231 */
01610   hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_REQUEST,1);
01611   delay_us(TIME_CCA);
01612   while ((cca & 0x80) == 0 ) {
01613     cca=hal_register_read(RG_TRX_STATUS);
01614   }
01615 #endif
01616   
01617   if(radio_was_off) {
01618     rf230_off();
01619   }
01620 // if (cca & 0x40) {/*DEBUGFLOW('3')*/;} else {rf230_pending=1;DEBUGFLOW('4');}  
01621    if (cca & 0x40) {
01622 //   DEBUGFLOW('5');
01623          SREG=saved_sreg; 
01624          return 1;
01625    } else {
01626 //  DEBUGFLOW('6');
01627  busyexit:
01628          SREG=saved_sreg;
01629          return 0;
01630    }
01631 }
01632 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01633 int
01634 rf230_receiving_packet(void)
01635 {
01636   uint8_t radio_state;
01637   if (hal_get_slptr()) {
01638     DEBUGFLOW('=');
01639   } else {  
01640     radio_state = hal_subregister_read(SR_TRX_STATUS);
01641     if ((radio_state==BUSY_RX) || (radio_state==BUSY_RX_AACK)) {
01642 //      DEBUGFLOW('8');
01643 //        rf230_pending=1;
01644       return 1;
01645     }
01646   }
01647   return 0;
01648 }
01649 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01650 static int
01651 rf230_pending_packet(void)
01652 {
01653   if (rf230_pending) DEBUGFLOW('@');
01654   return rf230_pending;
01655 }
01656 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01657 #if RF230_CONF_SNEEZER && JACKDAW
01658 /* See A.2 in the datasheet for the sequence needed.
01659  * This version for RF230 only, hence Jackdaw.
01660  * A full reset seems not necessary and allows keeping the pan address, etc.
01661  * for an easy reset back to network mode.
01662  */
01663 void rf230_start_sneeze(void) {
01664 //write buffer with random data for uniform spectral noise
01665 
01666 //uint8_t txpower = hal_register_read(0x05);  //save auto_crc bit and power
01667 //  hal_set_rst_low();
01668 //  hal_set_slptr_low();
01669 //  delay_us(TIME_RESET);
01670 //  hal_set_rst_high();
01671     hal_register_write(0x0E, 0x01);
01672     hal_register_write(0x02, 0x03);
01673     hal_register_write(0x03, 0x10);
01674  // hal_register_write(0x08, 0x20+26);    //channel 26
01675     hal_subregister_write(SR_CCA_MODE,1); //leave channel unchanged
01676 
01677  // hal_register_write(0x05, 0x00);       //output power maximum
01678     hal_subregister_write(SR_TX_AUTO_CRC_ON, 0);  //clear AUTO_CRC, leave output power unchanged
01679  
01680     hal_register_read(0x01);             //should be trx-off state=0x08  
01681     hal_frame_write(buffer, 127);        //maximum length, random for spectral noise 
01682 
01683     hal_register_write(0x36,0x0F);       //configure continuous TX
01684     hal_register_write(0x3D,0x00);       //Modulated frame, other options are:
01685 //  hal_register_write(RG_TX_2,0x10);    //CW -2MHz
01686 //  hal_register_write(RG_TX_2,0x80);    //CW -500KHz
01687 //  hal_register_write(RG_TX_2,0xC0);    //CW +500KHz
01688 
01689     DDRB  |= 1<<7;                       //Raven USB stick has PB7 connected to the RF230 TST pin.   
01690     PORTB |= 1<<7;                       //Raise it to enable continuous TX Test Mode.
01691 
01692     hal_register_write(0x02,0x09);       //Set TRX_STATE to PLL_ON
01693     delay_us(TIME_TRX_OFF_TO_PLL_ACTIVE);
01694     delay_us(TIME_PLL_LOCK);
01695     delay_us(TIME_PLL_LOCK);
01696  // while (hal_register_read(0x0f)!=1) {continue;}  //wait for pll lock-hangs
01697     hal_register_write(0x02,0x02);       //Set TRX_STATE to TX_START
01698 }
01699 #endif
